title: 12 Best Bath Mats and Bath Rugs for Elevating Your Space in 2025
description: From absorbent, art-piece rugs to handsome stone surfaces
author: Audrey Lee, Julia Harrison
excerpt: Put the final touches on your bathroom with one of the best bath mats. Read on for our editors' choices that are soft, absorbent, and beautifully designed

html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, we may receive compensation from retailers and/or from purchases of products through these links.

Whether you’ve recently remodeled your bathroom or just want to make your existing one look less, well, sad, the best bath mats can do a lot to inject personality in the dampest, most poorly lit room of the home. The lowly bath mat often gets overlooked among the other finer details, like the shower curtain, or the plush bath towels, but trust us that the right underfoot accessory will do a lot of heavy lifting when it comes to how your bathroom makes you feel. Damp and waterlogged fabrics are an immediate mood-killer after a hot shower, but a plush, absorbent one or a solid stone or wood surface can do wonders for soaking in moisture and keeping you dry and one degree of separation away from a cold tile floor.

To narrow down the finest ones for a range of abodes, our staffers put several of them to the test within our very own city apartments (that are notorious for being poorly aerated). Below, our definitive and growing list of bath mats that we feel are super absorbent and beautifully designed, along with a few additional picks that we haven’t had the chance to try but think you might like a whole lot.

Our Top Picks for the Best Bath Mats:

  • Best Basic Bath Mat: Parachute Classic Turkish Cotton Tub Mat, $59
  • Best Budget Bath Mat: Brooklinen Bath Mat, $29
  • Best Stone Bath Mat: Dorai Bath Mat, $90
  • Most Personality: Cold Picnic Toucan Bathmat, $70
  • Super Absorbent Bath Mat: Quince Turkish Cotton Bath Mat Bundle, $65

The Best Bath Mats, Overall

Best Basic Bath Mat

Parachute Classic Turkish Cotton Tub Mat

  • Dimensions: 20" x 31"
  • Materials: 100% Turkish cotton
  • Colors: Four colors available
  • Care Instructions: Machine wash cold, tumble dry on low

Tester: Rachel Fletcher, commerce director

“This 100% Turkish cotton bath mat feels much more expensive than its $59 price tag thanks to the thick plushness underfoot. I was a little concerned that something so dense might be constantly damp or take forever to dry but I’ve found it to be quite the opposite after using it for more than a year. I absolutely love Parachute’s waffle towels (they’re the only ones I’ll use!), so I was pleased that their bath mat was a high quality option too.”

Best Budget Bath Mat

Brooklinen Bath Mat

  • Dimensions: 20" x 31" (standard size), 24" x 40" (oversized)
  • Materials: 100% Turkish cotton
  • Colors: Eight colors available
  • Care Instructions: Machine wash cold, tumble dry on low (do not bleach)

Tester: Audrey Lee, commerce editor

“Brooklinen’s bath mat is reliable, well-made, and will easily blend in with your existing bathroom decor. What this mat may lack in bells and whistles, it certainly makes up for in practicality. The terry cloth material isn’t overly plush but feels nice underfoot—similar to a more densely woven towel. It typically takes around an hour for the mat to dry after I’ve used it. The best part about this mat is how easy it is to wash—you can toss it in with your other towels and not have to worry about any shedding or non-slip coating coming off in the washer or dryer.”

Best Stone Bath Mat

Dorai Bath Stone Mat

  • Dimensions: 26.5" x 1.6"
  • Materials: Compressed diatomaceous earth and recycled paper
  • Colors: Slate, sandstone
  • Care Instructions: For mild stains or scuffs, get your product damp and use the included sanding paper (150 grit or similar) to gently ‘wet sand’ off any marks

Tester: Julia Harrison, commerce writer

“I try not to be too hyperbolic in my product reviews, but I will literally never use another bath mat after meeting the Dorai. Its unassuming yet elevated design blends into your bathroom tile situation, and at just under two feet, it suits a small bathroom as well as a large one. The accompanying rug pad guarantees an anti-slip surface—not that it’s so much of a concern when your bath mat is made from stone. It’s one of few products I’ve come across in my life that works exactly as advertised, absorbing water in less than two minutes. And I mean: a lot of water. It’s completely impervious to mold or yuckiness, which I can’t say of any other bath mat. Plus its simple design blends easily with any style.”

Most Personality

Cold Picnic Toucan Bathmat

  • Dimensions: 20" x 30"
  • Materials: Organic cotton, non-slip rubber backing
  • Colors: Multiple
  • Care: Machine wash individually on cold/delicate cycle and machine dry

Tester: Audrey Lee, commerce editor

“Cold Picnic’s Toucan Bathmat is undoubtedly the nicest I’ve ever owned—you could just as easily mount it to your wall as an unexpected art piece. The tufted texture feels extremely luxurious underfoot and the cotton dries in under an hour after I’ve used it. Care instructions recommend washing the mat by itself, so it’s slightly higher maintenance than something like Brooklinen’s bath mat—it also means you might not be able to wash it as frequently—so that’s definitely something to consider if you’re looking at this for your bathroom.”

Super Absorbent

Quince Turkish Cotton Bath Mat Bundle

  • Dimensions: 21" x 34"
  • Materials: 100% premium, long staple Turkish cotton
  • Colors: White, gray, silver, mineral
  • Care: Machine wash cool with like colors using mild laundry detergent

Tester: Nashia Baker, senior commerce editor

"I’ve used Quince’s bath mat bundle for months now and I can confidently say that the Turkish cotton material quickly absorbs water—even with back-to-back guests stepping on them after using the shower. These are simple design-wise and soft underfoot. My new place has a larger bathroom, and it’s nice having this set to line both my bathtub and sink. But even if you have a smaller bathroom, it’s worth it. I liked having one clean mat on deck to instantly swap whenever the other needed a wash in my old apartment. These don’t have the typical rubber backing you’ll find in a standard bath mat, so just keep in mind that they might shift a bit when walking on them."

More Bath Mats to Check Out

Though we haven’t had a moment to test all the bath mats in the world, we do have our eyes on a few more from our favorite retailers. Here, a couple more options to bookmark if you’re in the market for a handsome bath mat that will keep you dry and might even put a smile on your face as you groggily get ready for the day.

Kaylee Sahara Knitted Bath Rug

Wayfair is another great retailer with seemingly endless options of both practical and more fanciful bath mats. Over 200 customers gave this bohemian bathroom rug five stars for its style and durability. It’s washing machine friendly, with a non-slip latex backing for stability, and has a chic design that gives your bathroom a necessary dose of personality.

Roan Iris Ziggy Bath Mat

We love this style from Anthropologie that’s handwoven in Ethiopia from hand-spun and hand-dyed cotton. These only improve with wear, softening and settling into their style. They also work incredibly well as kitchen mats, door mats, bedside mats…. Need we go on?

Legends Hotel Regal Bath Rug

The Company Store is another tried-and-true retailer for high-quality bedding and bath gear. Take the Regal Bath Rug from their Legends Hotel collection, a combed cotton bestseller that’s available in five sizes, 17(!) different colors, and has over 900 five-star reviews to its credit (many from shoppers who attest that they’ll be repurchasing).

Gorilla Grip Shower Mat

Maybe it’s far from gorgeous, but it makes for a safe landing beneath the other gorgeous bath mats you’ll surely put on top of it. This bath mat has racked up over 90,000 positive reviews for being completely immovable, with a rubber backing suction grip that you can use inside or outside the shower.

Quiet Town Reyes Bath Mat

Quiet Town makes some of our favorite bath essentials (we’ve waxed poetic about their shower curtains) for being high-quality and featuring unexpected statement designs in spaces that can otherwise lean a little neutral (see: white, beige). This bath mat references a kilim-style rug while still delivering plush comfort and high-absorbency. It’s 100% cotton, meaning it’s machine washable in the event it picks up a little dirt from your feet or bathroom floor.

Tekla Terry Bath Mat

You can rely on Tekla for three things: quality, stripes, and terry cloth. This neutral striped choice could suit nearly any bathroom landscape. Its natural habitat might be a clean, streamlined Scandinavian look, but it could just as easily mediate a big-personality bathroom or be the clincher piece on a drab rental bathroom.

Nordstrom Organic Hydrocotton Bath Mat

Here’s a tip: Nordstrom has a wide bath mat selection that includes brands you might not have known are available from the retailer. We’re talking Matouk, Baina, and even a couple of very splurgeworthy Versace designs. In terms of options that are durable, affordable, quick drying, and easy to care for, we recommend this Turkish cotton bath mat from Nordstrom’s in-house line.

FAQs

What is the purpose of a bath mat?

Besides the practical uses of bath mats and rugs, it’s a bathroom accessory that can make an often forgotten area of your home feel more put together. Looking to bring an artistic feel to the space? Look to Cold Picnic. In the market for something practical and no-fuss for a guest bathroom? Brooklinen and The Company Store are go-tos for sensible, handsome options. In the middle ground you can find everything from grandiose to modest at retailers like Amazon and Nordstrom, or West Elm and Anthropologie.

How often should I replace my bath mat?

According to our friends at Parachute: “If you use it daily, you should replace your bath mat once a year or so.” That said, if you’re consistently washing and caring for your mat, you may be able to keep it even longer (especially if it’s a mat in a guest room or room that’s used less).

How do I care for my bath mat?

Think of these like clothing—different styles require specific care instructions. While some bathroom mats, like Brooklinen’s, can easily be thrown into the wash with your other towels, others should be washed in their own cycle (usually styles which feature non-slip backing). More dust-prone fabrics like high-pile options may require low maintenance upkeep like a brush or a quick vacuum between washes. We recommend referencing the care instructions that can typically be found on the packaging or the website product page.

What are the best quality bath rugs?

The best bath mat and bath rugs will depend on your space and personal preferences. If you ask commerce writer Julia, nothing beats diatomaceous earth, a stone-like material that absorbs water in less than a minute. Commerce editor Audrey will tell you her Cold Picnic bath mat doubles as functional art, making it a clear winner. Senior commerce editor Nashia might tell you her super-absorbent Quince bath mat reigns supreme. No matter what you’re looking for, our list has options to satisfy all tastes, from modern stone designs to 100% wool or cotton bath rugs options that are likely to deliver on absorbency and durability.

What are the top-rated bath mats for preventing slips in the bathroom?

If you’re in the market for the grippiest bath mat possible—a valid concern especially for more senior shoppers—Amazon’s gorilla grip bath mats have received stellar reviews for their ability to stay solidly in place. Plus, you can lay a more appealing bath mat over top to maintain both style and grip at once. Beware, however, of possible mildew growth underneath gorilla grip mats, as the plastic can harbor heat and humidity—best to rinse these off every once in a while!
